> -----Original Message-----
> From: Michael Silverstein [mailto:msilverstein@...]
[snip] 
> This brings up a question that I've been pondering: Given a 
> test T, which of the following two choices is more desirable?
>    o Enable profiling for T by specifying some preference and let the
>      execution framework do the rest.

The first way is way more preferable.  Toggle switches are great.  For
example, JRun's Servlet/JSP profiling mechanism (a development feature we
have) is all properties based -- we instrument the user's byte code before
it's loaded into the classloader.  This makes the whole thing transparent to
users, except for enabling/disabling and customizing the behavior through
properties files.  No pre-compiler or separate classes or compilation steps.

Scott Stirling
JRun QA
Macromedia
